org.apache.juneau.serializer

Class SerializerGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Lockable
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public final class SerializerGroup
extends Lockable
    Represents a group of Serializers that can be looked up by media type.
    Description:

    Provides the following features:

    • Finds serializers based on HTTP Accept header values.
    • Sets common properties on all serializers in a single method call.
    • Locks all serializers in a single method call.
    • Clones existing groups and all serializers within the group in a single method call.
    Match ordering

    Serializers are matched against Accept strings in the order they exist in this group.

    Adding new entries will cause the entries to be prepended to the group. This allows for previous serializers to be overridden through subsequent calls.

    For example, calling g.append(S1.class,S2.class).append(S3.class,S4.class) will result in the order S3, S4, S1, S2.

    Example:

    // Construct a new serializer group SerializerGroup g = new SerializerGroup(); // Add some serializers to it g.append(JsonSerializer.class, XmlSerializer.class); // Change settings for all serializers in the group and lock it. g.setProperty(SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_useWhitespace, true) .addPojoSwaps(CalendarSwap.ISO8601DT.class) .lock(); // Find the appropriate serializer by Accept type String mediaTypeMatch = g.findMatch("text/foo, text/json;q=0.8, text/*;q:0.6, *\/*;q=0.0"); WriterSerializer s = (WriterSerializer)g.getSerializer(mediaTypeMatch); // Serialize a bean to JSON text AddressBook addressBook = new AddressBook(); // Bean to serialize. String json = s.serialize(addressBook);

      • getSerializerMatch

        public SerializerMatch getSerializerMatch(String acceptHeader)
        Searches the group for a serializer that can handle the specified Accept value.

        The accept value complies with the syntax described in RFC2616, Section 14.1, as described below:

        Accept = "Accept" ":" #( media-range [ accept-params ] ) media-range = ( "*\/*" | ( type "/" "*" ) | ( type "/" subtype ) ) *( ";" parameter ) accept-params = ";" "q" "=" qvalue *( accept-extension ) accept-extension = ";" token [ "=" ( token | quoted-string ) ]

        The general idea behind having the serializer resolution be a two-step process is so that the matched media type can be passed in to the Serializer.doSerialize(SerializerSession, Object) method. For example...

        String acceptHeaderValue = request.getHeader("Accept"); String matchingMediaType = group.findMatch(acceptHeaderValue); if (matchingMediaType == null) throw new RestException(SC_NOT_ACCEPTABLE); WriterSerializer s = (WriterSerializer)group.getSerializer(matchingMediaType); s.serialize(getPojo(), response.getWriter(), response.getProperties(), matchingMediaType);

        Parameters:
        acceptHeader - The HTTP Accept header string.
        Returns:
        The serializer and media type that matched the accept header, or null if no match was made.

      • getSerializerMatch

        public SerializerMatch getSerializerMatch(MediaType mediaType)
        Same as getSerializerMatch(String) but matches using a MediaType instance.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - The HTTP media type.
        Returns:
        The serializer and media type that matched the media type, or null if no match was made.

      • getSerializer

        public Serializer getSerializer(String acceptHeader)
        Same as getSerializerMatch(String) but returns just the matched serializer.
        Parameters:
        acceptHeader - The HTTP Accept header string.
        Returns:
        The serializer that matched the accept header, or null if no match was made.

      • getSerializer

        public Serializer getSerializer(MediaType mediaType)
        Same as getSerializerMatch(MediaType) but returns just the matched serializer.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - The HTTP media type.
        Returns:
        The serializer that matched the accept header, or null if no match was made.

      • getSupportedMediaTypes

        public List<MediaType> getSupportedMediaTypes()
        Returns the media types that all parsers in this group can handle

        Entries are ordered in the same order as the parsers in the group.

        Returns:
        The list of media types.
